channel.title: Comets
channel.description: Various images of the chunks of rock and ice orbiting our Sun, sometimes including their signature tails.

item.title: Comet Neat
item.description: Comet Neat is visible as a fuzzy "star" in this ~3 minute star trail taken from Pinkney's back yard.
item.media:description: Comet Neat is visible as a fuzzy "star" in this ~3 minute star trail taken from Pinkney's back yard.

item.title: Comet Holmes in Perseus
item.description: Comet Holmes reached naked-eye brightness in 2007 after some amazing outbursts. It is the fuzzy object just left of the bright stars of Perseus.
item.media:description: Comet Holmes reached naked-eye brightness in 2007 after some amazing outbursts. It is the fuzzy object just left of the bright stars of Perseus.

item.title: Comet Holmes from back yard
item.description: Comet Holmes in the constellation Perseus in fall of 2007. The foreground tree leaves were lit up by yellowish security lights.
item.media:description: Comet Holmes in the constellation Perseus in fall of 2007. The foreground tree leaves were lit up by yellowish security lights.

item.title: Comet Holmes close up
item.description: Comet Holmes underwent an outburst in 2012 that made it visible to the naked-eye. This image was taken with a Canon Digital Rebel XT on the 12" Meade with a focal reducer that caused flaring/blurriness.
item.media:description: Comet Holmes underwent an outburst in 2012 that made it visible to the naked-eye. This image was taken with a Canon Digital Rebel XT on the 12" Meade with a focal reducer that caused flaring/blurriness.

item.title: Comet Holmes
item.description: Comet Holmes underwent an outburst in 2012 that made it visible to the naked-eye. This image was taken with a Canon Digital Rebel XT on the 12" Meade with a focal reducer that caused star flaring/blurriness. Apparently tracking was off, hence trailing.
item.media:description: Comet Holmes underwent an outburst in 2012 that made it visible to the naked-eye. This image was taken with a Canon Digital Rebel XT on the 12" Meade with a focal reducer that caused star flaring/blurriness. Apparently tracking was off, hence trailing.

item.title: Comet 103P/Hartley 2 ?
item.description: Most likely Comet 103P/ Hartley 2 since that was the brightest comet in Oct 2010, but this comet is fainter than the 5th magnitude reported by others. Digital Rebel on 12".
item.media:description: Most likely Comet 103P/ Hartley 2 since that was the brightest comet in Oct 2010, but this comet is fainter than the 5th magnitude reported by others. Digital Rebel on 12".

item.title: Comet Garradd?
item.description: Most likely comet C/2009 P1 (Garradd), since it was the brightest comet of (October) 2011. At the time it was near magnitude 6.6. Taken with DSI II on 10/24/11.
item.media:description: Most likely comet C/2009 P1 (Garradd), since it was the brightest comet of (October) 2011. At the time it was near magnitude 6.6. Taken with DSI II on 10/24/11.

item.title: Comet C/2009 P1 (Garradd)
item.description: Comet C/2009 P1 Garradd imaged by the Atik CCD on the 80 mm APO on 3/22/12. The colors are redder than actual colors (which are normally greenish). This comet sports a fanned out tail above the coma.
item.media:description: Comet C/2009 P1 Garradd imaged by the Atik CCD on the 80 mm APO on 3/22/12. The colors are redder than actual colors (which are normally greenish). This comet sports a fanned out tail above the coma.

item.title: Comet Hergenrother
item.description: A GIF animation of comet Hergenrother. Taken with the Meade DSI II on 10/12/12.
item.media:description: A GIF animation of comet Hergenrother. Taken with the Meade DSI II on 10/12/12.

item.title: Comet 168/P Hergenrother
item.description: Comet Hergenrother with the Meade DSI II on the 12" Meade. Attempted to guide on the comet nucleus which makes the stars have trails.
item.media:description: Comet Hergenrother with the Meade DSI II on the 12" Meade. Attempted to guide on the comet nucleus which makes the stars have trails.

item.title: Comet C/2011 L4 PanSTARRS
item.description: Comet C/2011 L4 PanSTARRS in 3/14/13 taken with the Canon Digital Rebel with its kit lens on a tripod. This comet was barely visible to the naked eye. The comet's tail points roughly upwards and away from the Sun (which is the norm).
item.media:description: Comet C/2011 L4 PanSTARRS in 3/14/13 taken with the Canon Digital Rebel with its kit lens on a tripod. This comet was barely visible to the naked eye. The comet's tail points roughly upwards and away from the Sun (which is the norm).

item.title: PanSTARRS at Sunset
item.description: A movie of comet C/2011 L4 (PanSTARRS) and its visible tail as the sun sets. It moves from slightly left of middle center (hard to see at first) to slightly right of bottom center. Taken 3/14/13.
item.media:description: A movie of comet C/2011 L4 (PanSTARRS) and its visible tail as the sun sets. It moves from slightly left of middle center (hard to see at first) to slightly right of bottom center. Taken 3/14/13.

item.title: PanSTARRS at Sunset 2
item.description: Another movie of comet C/2011 L4 (PanSTARRS). It moves from slightly left of top center to slightly right of bottom center. Taken 3/19/13.
item.media:description: Another movie of comet C/2011 L4 (PanSTARRS). It moves from slightly left of top center to slightly right of bottom center. Taken 3/19/13.

item.title: Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy)
item.description: Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) seen on Jan 15, 2015. Imaged with the Atik CCD on the 80 mm APO refractor through RGB filters. This one has fairly accurate colors! 2x binning.
item.media:description: Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) seen on Jan 15, 2015. Imaged with the Atik CCD on the 80 mm APO refractor through RGB filters. This one has fairly accurate colors! 2x binning.

item.title: Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson)
item.description: Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson) on 5/12/2017. Taken with the Atik CCD on Meade 80 mm Apo. It was about 7th magnitude.
item.media:description: Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson) on 5/12/2017. Taken with the Atik CCD on Meade 80 mm Apo. It was about 7th magnitude.

item.title: Comet Johnson Movie
item.description: A movie of Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson) on 6/24/17. It is the fuzzy object near the top middle, moving upward. It reached perihelion on June 12th, and is currently about 7th magnitude.
item.media:description: A movie of Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson) on 6/24/17. It is the fuzzy object near the top middle, moving upward. It reached perihelion on June 12th, and is currently about 7th magnitude.

item.title: Comet ASASSN
item.description: A short movie of Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) moving through the sky, in black and white. It is the faint object, which appears to be moving quickly, but this is due to the framerate of the video. Taken with Atik on 10/17/17, at about magnitude 8.5.
item.media:description: A short movie of Comet C/2017 O1 (ASASSN) moving through the sky, in black and white. It is the faint object, which appears to be moving quickly, but this is due to the framerate of the video. Taken with Atik on 10/17/17, at about magnitude 8.5.

item.title: Comet 64P Animation
item.description: Two black-and-white images of Comet 64P Swift-Gehrels combined into a GIF animation showing the direction of its movement. Taken with Atik on 11/06/18.
item.media:description: Two black-and-white images of Comet 64P Swift-Gehrels combined into a GIF animation showing the direction of its movement. Taken with Atik on 11/06/18.

item.title: Comet 64P/Swift-Gehrels
item.description: Comet 64P/Swift-Gehrels imaged with the Atik CCD on the Celestron 11-inch on 11/6/2018. Colors not very accurate.
item.media:description: Comet 64P/Swift-Gehrels imaged with the Atik CCD on the Celestron 11-inch on 11/6/2018. Colors not very accurate.

item.title: Comet 46P Animation
item.description: A GIF animation of Comet 46P/Wirtanen, created from multiple exposures taken with the Canon T5i on 12/07/18. Some trailing is noticeable on some longer exposures, where the comet appears elongated.
item.media:description: A GIF animation of Comet 46P/Wirtanen, created from multiple exposures taken with the Canon T5i on 12/07/18. Some trailing is noticeable on some longer exposures, where the comet appears elongated.
